ygData.msgSnippet: Furthermore, interplanetary travel will be biased to the small factions who have enough trouble functioning on one planet. Could we at least say after Beast

Furthermore, interplanetary travel will be biased to the small 
factions who have enough trouble functioning on one planet. Could we 
at least say after Beast Wars they jumped about 300 years into the 
future so none of that stuff has happened YET when we arrive. Besides 
why would it be TRANSFORMERS then, if they weren't on another planet 
what reasom would they have for aquiring beast and vehicle modes and 
then what fun would it be?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Vincent Price" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> OOC: Yo, be forewarned of the curse. Cybertron lacks any fun what so 
ever. And it's a place I'm definitely never moving my characters to, 
even if I'm the only person with characters left on Earth...
> 
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: KSLawdogg@c... 
>   To: nbwrpg@y... 
>   Sent: Wednesday, November 21, 2001 3:09 PM
>   Subject: Re: Debate (important everyone read)
> 
> 
>   (Going to Cybertron would be cool.  If an RPG died because of it 
would be 
>   because no one wanted to go Cybertron (obvious there) or because 
it wasn't 
>   done right.  Cybertron isn't really explored that much in the 
American 
>   Transformers cartoon, which is the only one I've seen.  I'd agree 
with LN, 
>   don't base it on Beast Machines.  Yuk.  
> 
>   Also, on Cybertron, we could do more stuff.  In example, the first 
two 
>   seasons of TFs, undoubtedly the best but I guess you could say 
'restricted' 
>   to Earth and occassional visits to Earth.  Season three, 
undoubtedly not the 
>   best, did have many episodes OFF of Cybertron and Earth.  Going to 
different 
>   planets, etc.  A good concept there, even if most art and writing 
was...shall 
>   we say lacking?  Again, season three wasn't the best but it had a 
LOT of 
>   opportunities that this RPG would have as well.  Not to mention 
we'd get to 
>   make our own Cybertron and, well, yeah, I went over that.
> 
>   The biggest problem is we'd have to make our own Cybertron.  I 
mean, we know 
>   what Earth looks like, all the places, the geography.  Buuuut, we 
don't know 
>   that for Cybertron and we'd need to create it.
> 
>   As for the protohumans, early in the RPG people were equipping 
huge gumby 
>   squads of protohumans with weapons and using them as massively 
destructive 
>   armies so they were banned, as they should be.  The RPG's got 
along fine with 
>   gumbies that can't fight.
> 
> 
>   -L. Unitron   
>
